last_episode_to_air.name: Yogi's Birthday Party
last_episode_to_air.overview:
In this episode-length cartoon, Yogi is told that he'll be appearing on a television program. He tries to prepare for the show by taking lessons from Fred Upstairs, Boppy Barrin, and Lee B. Rocky (spoofs of Fred Astaire, Bobby Darin, and Liberace, respectively), but the lessons don't go well. Yogi is afraid that he'll ruin the show, but at the last minute he discovers that it's actually a surprise birthday tribute for him and that he doesn't have to do anything.

The "guests" who show up to honor Yogi include Ranger Smith, Huckleberry Hound, Quick Draw McGraw and Baba Looey, Pixie and Dixie and Mr. Jinks, Snooper and Blabber, Snagglepuss, Hokey Wolf and Ding-A-Ling, Augie Doggie and Doggie Daddy, Cindy Bear, Boo Boo, and Yakky Doodle.

name: The Yogi Bear Show
overview: From his home in Jellystone Park, Yogi Bear dreams of nothing more in life than to outwit as many unsuspecting tourists as he can and grab their prized picnic baskets all while staying one step ahead of the ever-exasperated Ranger Smith. Yogi's little buddy, Boo-Boo, tries to keep Yogi out of trouble but rarely succeeds. That's okay because not even Ranger Smith can stay mad for long at the lovable, irresistible Yogi Bear.
tagline: He's smarter than the average bear!

episodes.name: Oinks and Boinks
episodes.overview: Yogi and Boo Boo are tricked by the Three Little Pigs into moving into the straw house, then the wood house, just before each is blown down by the wolf. This cartoon was originally shown on The Huckleberry Hound Show.

episodes.name: Major Operation
episodes.overview: To avoid being ejected from the Adventurers Club, Major Minor tries to hunt Snagglepuss again, despite the fact that the lion is now in a zoo.

episodes.name: Out of Luck Duck
episodes.overview: Unable to keep up with the other migrating ducks, Yakky falls into Chopper's water dish and meets the bulldog for the first time.

episodes.name: Booby Trapped Bear
episodes.overview: After Yogi poses as a health inspector in order to take tourists' picnic baskets, Ranger Smith sets out some booby-trapped baskets to teach Yogi a lesson.

episodes.name: Feud for Thought
episodes.overview: Two hill people are competing for a woman's hand in marriage, and she says that she'll choose the one who brings her a lion fur coat; naturally, the suitors both hunt Snagglepuss.

episodes.name: Hop, Duck and Listen
episodes.overview: Flying to Missouri, Yakky gets lost and finds himself in Australia, where he befriends a baby kangaroo who "adopts" him as his brother.

episodes.name: Gleesome Threesome
episodes.overview: Ranger Smith goes on vacation in Miami Beach; Yogi and Boo Boo, mistakenly thinking that they're invited, show up at the Ranger's hotel.

episodes.name: Live and Lion
episodes.overview: Finding Yakky Doodle hiding in his mailbox, Snagglepuss contemplates eating him, but instead finds himself protecting Yakky from duck hunters.

episodes.name: Dog Flight
episodes.overview: Learning that Chopper wishes he could fly, Yakky tries to teach him, with painful results.

episodes.name: A Bear Pair
episodes.overview: Boo Boo enters a mail-in puzzle contest and wins a trip for two to Paris; he takes along Yogi, who almost causes an international incident.

episodes.name: Fraidy Cat Lion
episodes.overview: Snagglepuss shows up at the home of Mr. & Mrs. J. Evil Scientist, begging for food; J. Evil hires him to get rid of a mouse, which Junior had transformed into a giant.

episodes.name: Easter Duck
episodes.overview: A lady buys Yakky from a pet store as an Easter gift for her granddaughter; the lady's cat, however, has different plans for the duckling.

episodes.name: Spy Guy
episodes.overview: Ranger Smith has a system of closed-circuit cameras set up throughout Jellystone so he can keep an eye on Yogi.

episodes.name: Royal Ruckus
episodes.overview: In a Medieval kingdom, Snagglepuss tries to rescue the Queen, who's been kidnapped by Count Down.

episodes.name: Foxy Duck
episodes.overview: Fibber Fox disguises himself as Yakky's mother as part of a plot to get at the chickens in the henhouse Chopper is guarding.

episodes.name: Do or Diet
episodes.overview: At Ranger Smith's request, a doctor tells Yogi that his health will be in jeopardy if he doesn't stick to a diet of nuts and berries.

episodes.name: The Roaring Lion
episodes.overview: Hungry Snagglepuss infiltrates a college because he heard they have "sheepskins," and he reasons that they must have sheep; he winds up being the quarterback of the football team.

episodes.name: Railroaded Duck
episodes.overview: Yakky and Chopper are traveling by train, and so is a cat who keeps trying to eat Yakky.

episodes.name: Bears and Bees
episodes.overview: Yogi finds a hollow log filled with bees' honey, and trades jars of it for goodies from the tourists.

episodes.name: Paws for Applause
episodes.overview: Snagglepuss gets a job as a television actor, but it turns out to be a lot rougher than he'd expected.

episodes.name: Duck Hunting
episodes.overview: Duhh-glas the Dog is supposed to help his master hunt ducks, but the dog can't stand to see Yakky get shot.

episodes.name: Biggest Show-Off on Earth
episodes.overview: An escaped circus bear trades places with Yogi; Yogi has a terrible time trying to perform dangerous acts, while the more feral circus bear proves to be impossible for the rangers to control.

episodes.name: Knights and Daze
episodes.overview: Hoping to become a member of King Arthur's Round Table, Snagglepuss does battle with the Stormy Knight.

episodes.name: Whistle-Stop and Go
episodes.overview: In gratitude for being released from a dog catcher's wagon, Chopper gives Yakky a whistle, which the duck uses to call for help when Fibber Fox tries to eat him.

episodes.name: Genial Genie
episodes.overview: Yogi and Boo Boo find a lamp containing a genie, and Yogi wishes for a flying carpet.

episodes.name: The Gangsters All Here
episodes.overview: Two gangsters use Snagglepuss' cave as a hideout.

episodes.name: Duck the Music
episodes.overview: Yakky's terrible singing drives a cat to distraction.

episodes.name: Cub Scout Boo Boo
episodes.overview: When a boy scout troop sets up camp in Jellystone, Yogi and Boo Boo pose as scouts to get some food.

episodes.name: Having a Bowl
episodes.overview: The Major's baby nephew runs away from home, and Snagglepuss brings him back.

episodes.name: School Fool
episodes.overview: Yakky goes to school and is picked on by a bigger kid; Chopper disguises himself as a student so he can keep an eye on Yakky.

episodes.name: Home Sweet Jellystone
episodes.overview: When he inherits wealth and a mansion, Ranger Smith moves away from Jellystone.

episodes.name: Diaper Desperado
episodes.overview: An outlaw called Big Hombre orders Snagglepuss to look after his baby, Little Hombre, while he goes off to rob a bank.

episodes.name: Oh Duckter
episodes.overview: Yakky visits Chopper in the animal hospital, and Fibber Fox sneaks in to try to catch Yakky.

episodes.name: Love-Bugged Bear
episodes.overview: Yogi has been struck by Cupid's arrow (literally), and he's too busy pursuing a female bear to go after picnic baskets.

episodes.name: Arrow Error
episodes.overview: Inspired by the story of Robin Hood, Snagglepuss sets out to be a champion for all in need – including an elephant who's escaped from the zoo.

episodes.name: It's a Duck's Life
episodes.overview: Chopper's master is going duck hunting, and Chopper is trying to keep Yakky from being shot.

episodes.name: Bearface Disguise
episodes.overview: Ranger Smith disguises himself as a bear, hoping to catch Yogi in the act of stealing picnic baskets.

episodes.name: Twice Shy
episodes.overview: The Major's identical twin brother, Sir Clyde, believes that all animals should be free; Snagglepuss is confused when the Major keeps locking him in a cage and Sir Clyde keeps freeing him.

episodes.name: Happy Birthdaze
episodes.overview: Yakky gets a birthday present for Chopper – a dinosaur bone from a museum.

episodes.name: Slap Happy Birthday
episodes.overview: Ranger Smith is trying to find out what Yogi is up to, not realizing that the bear is putting together a surprise birthday party for him.

episodes.name: Cloak and Stagger
episodes.overview: When Snagglepuss tries to join the Three Musketeers, they trick him into thinking that the king is a spy.

episodes.name: Horse Collared
episodes.overview: A farmer's old plow-horse mistakenly thinks that the farmer wants to shoot him, so Yakky helps him hide.

episodes.name: A Bear Living
episodes.overview: Yogi sets up a wishing well in the park, and uses the money people throw in to buy things.

episodes.name: Remember Your Lions
episodes.overview: Snagglepuss finally gets to perform Shakespeare on stage, but Major Minor is sitting in the audience.

episodes.name: Ha-Choo to You!
episodes.overview: Chopper has a cold, so Yakky brings him a basket full of goodies, which Fibber Fox tries to intercept (in the style of "Little Red Riding Hood").

episodes.name: Disguise and Gals
episodes.overview: Two bank robbers disguised as little old ladies hide out in Jellystone and conceal their loot in a picnic basket; naturally, Yogi gets involved.

episodes.name: Remember the Daze
episodes.overview: The Major and Snagglepuss are guests on a television show called This Is Your Strife (a parody of This Is Your Life), and the former chases the latter through various TV studios, including the one Yogi Bear's show is in. This cartoon also includes parodies of You Bet Your Life, western shows, game shows, Frankenstein, and science fiction shows.

episodes.name: Foxy Proxy
episodes.overview: When Yakky thinks that Fibber Fox is his mother, the fox finds that he can't bring himself to eat the duckling; this drives Fibber to see a psychiatrist.

episodes.name: Touch and Go-Go-Go
episodes.overview: The bears' fairy godmother grants Yogi the power to turn anything he touches into a picnic basket (à la Midas).

episodes.name: Express Trained Lion
episodes.overview: A mouse named Bigelow, whom Snagglepuss once freed from a mousetrap, is intent on freeing Snag from a zookeeper, despite the fact that the lion doesn't want to be freed. The main action takes place on a train, hence the title.

episodes.name: Count to Tenant
episodes.overview: After a flea is "evicted" from a dog's hide, kind-hearted Yakky offers to let the flea live on Chopper.

episodes.name: Acrobatty Yogi
episodes.overview: Cindy Bear is in a circus, so Yogi runs off to join it; the circus owner get him a job as a lion tamer.

episodes.name: Jangled Jungle
episodes.overview: Sick and tired of being part of a lion taming act, Snagglepuss runs away from the circus and goes back to the jungle, expecting to be the king of the beasts.

episodes.name: Shrunken Headache
episodes.overview: Using a child's chemistry set, Fibber Fox creates a formula that shrinks Chopper down to Yakky's size, and the fox chases after the two of them.

episodes.name: Ring-a-Ding Picnic Basket
episodes.overview: Ranger Smith tries to trap Yogi with an alarm-rigged picnic basket, and fails; later Yogi mistakenly thinks the Ranger wants him shot.

episodes.name: Lion Tracks
episodes.overview: A railroad company tries to put a track through Snagglepuss' cave, but Snag thwarts their efforts; the railroad then hires Major Minor to handle the situation.

episodes.name: The Most Ghost
episodes.overview: Chopper and Yakky stay in an abandoned house for the night; Fibber Fox disguises himself as a ghost, hoping to scare Chopper away so he can catch Yakky.

episodes.name: Iron Hand Jones
episodes.overview: When Ranger Smith goes on vacation, his seat is filled by Ranger "Iron Hand" Jones, who's more of a strict disciplinarian than Yogi can stand.

episodes.name: Fight Fright
episodes.overview: At the county fair, Snagglepuss is tired of being the target in an "African Dodger" type of game; he's talked into boxing with a kangaroo instead.

episodes.name: Stamp Scamp
episodes.overview: Chopper gives Yakky a trading stamp so his book will be completely filled, but the wind keeps blowing the stamp away from them.

episodes.name: Yogi's Pest Guest
episodes.overview: A Japanese bear who's a martial artist is transferred to Jellystone, and Yogi gets him addicted to picnic baskets.

episodes.name: Lions Share Sheriff
episodes.overview: An outlaw is intent on shooting the sheriff of a western town; after their sheriff runs away, the people appoint Snagglepuss their sheriff.

episodes.name: All's Well That Eats Well
episodes.overview: Alfy Gator, in his first appearance, tries to catch Yakky so the 'gator can dine on roast duck.

episodes.name: Missile Bound Yogi
episodes.overview: The army has its war games in a sealed-off part of the park; when Yogi wanders in, he thinks Jellystone has been invaded.

episodes.name: Cagey Lion
episodes.overview: Snagglepuss is being transported to the zoo on a riverboat; he escapes from his cage and poses as a riverboat gambler.

episodes.name: Foxy Friends
episodes.overview: Bigelow the Mouse (from the Snagglepuss cartoon "Express Trained Lion") helps Yakky to stay out of Fibber Fox's clutches.

episodes.name: Loco Locomotive
episodes.overview: When a kiddie train is added to the park, Yogi becomes determined to ride it.

episodes.name: Charge That Lion
episodes.overview: To evade hunters, Snagglepuss disguises himself as a soldier and winds up in an army camp.

episodes.name: Mad Mix Up
episodes.overview: A mad scientist switches Chopper's and Yakky's brains, and the two of them drive Fibber Fox crazy.

episodes.name: Missile-Bound Bear
episodes.overview: The military builds a secret rocket-launching base in Jellystone, and Yogi, Boo Boo, and Ranger Smith all wind up inside a space-bound rocket. This cartoon contains a great deal of satire of the military.

episodes.name: Be My Ghost
episodes.overview: Snagglepuss visits an old English castle, which is haunted by a pair of mischievous ghosts.

episodes.name: Beach Brawl
episodes.overview: Yakky and Chopper enjoy a day at the beach, until Fibber Fox starts chasing after Yakky again.

episodes.name: A Wooin' Bruin
episodes.overview: Yogi and another bear compete for Cindy's affections by bringing her gifts, committing a rash of thefts throughout the park in the process.

episodes.name: Spring Hits a Snag
episodes.overview: Snagglepuss protects a lioness named Lila (in her first appearance) from hunters by giving her shelter in his cave, but he soon finds her company less bearable than the hunters' bullets.

episodes.name: Duck Seasoning
episodes.overview: Alfy Gator is hunting Yakky again; in this cartoon, Yakky is unusually self-reliant as he fights back against Alfy.

episodes.name: Yogi in the City
episodes.overview: After falling asleep in a tourist's trailer, Yogi finds himself dodging cars in the big city.

episodes.name: Legal Eagle Lion
episodes.overview: A circuit judge is afraid to try a bank robber in a rough western town, so Snagglepuss steps in as judge, prosecutor, and a pair of witnesses.

episodes.name: Hasty Tasty
episodes.overview: Fibber Fox and Alfy Gator are both after Yakky, and the two of them fight over who's going to get him.

episodes.name: Queen Bee for a Day
episodes.overview: Yogi has Boo Boo dress up as a queen bee to lure bees away from their honey-filled hive, but an entomologist starts chasing Boo Boo.

episodes.name: Don't Know It Poet
episodes.overview: In this takeoff of Cyrano de Bergerac, professional poet Cyril D. Snagglepuss is hired to help a suitor win a lady's heart, but something has gone wrong.

episodes.name: Nobody Home Duck
episodes.overview: Yakky's wings are too weak to take him south for the impending winter, so Chopper tries to find him a home.

episodes.name: Batty Bear
episodes.overview: After sending in thousands of boxtops to a television show, Yogi receives a "Bat Guy" costume with functional bat-like wings, which he uses to swoop down on campers and steal their picnic baskets.

episodes.name: Tail Wag Snag
episodes.overview: Major Minor tries again to catch Snagglepuss, this time with the aid of Snuffles.

episodes.name: Dog Pounded
episodes.overview: Fibber Fox steals Chopper's dog tags and gets him captured by the dog catcher, thus leaving Yakky defenseless.

episodes.name: Droop-a-Long Yogi
episodes.overview: A television station is using part of Jellystone to shoot a western program, and Yogi and Ranger Smith get parts on the show.

episodes.name: Rent and Rave
episodes.overview: To raise money for a trip, Snagglepuss rents out part of his cave, but his new tenant – Lila – is more than he can stand.

episodes.name: Witch Duck-ter
episodes.overview: A witch is brewing a special recipe to celebrate her 110th birthday, and one of the ingredients is Yakky.

episodes.name: Threadbare Bear
episodes.overview: While being transported to the zoo, Yogi and Boo Boo escape into the woods, and start stealing food from stores and houses. The zoo they are intended to be transported to is the Cincinnati Zoo – coincidentally, Hanna-Barbera would be purchased by the Cincinnati-based Taft Broadcasting in 1967.

episodes.name: Footlight Fright
episodes.overview: Major Minor uses psychology to capture Snagglepuss, by playing on his dreams of becoming an actor.

episodes.name: Full Course Meal
episodes.overview: Alfy Gator invites Yakky to dinner, without mentioning that the duckling will be the main course; Yakky, however, brings his friend Chopper with him.

episodes.name: Ice Box Raider
episodes.overview: To prove that Yogi's been raiding his refrigerator, Ranger Smith rigs it with a practical joke; later, Yogi hatches a plan to get even.

episodes.name: One Two Many
episodes.overview: Snagglepuss' identical twin brother Snaggletooth comes to stay for the summer, and the two of them inadvertently confuse Lila.

episodes.name: Baddie Buddies
episodes.overview: Lost in the desert, Yakky tries to be friends with a dangerous outlaw, and his attentions prove to be detrimental to the outlaw.

episodes.name: Bear Foot Soldiers
episodes.overview: The army is playing war games in Jellystone, and one of the teams is disguising their soldiers as bears; of course, Yogi and Boo Boo get caught up in the games.

episodes.name: Royal Rodent
episodes.overview: The king hires Snagglepuss to rid his castle of Bigelow the Mouse.

episodes.name: Judo Ex-Expert
episodes.overview: Yakky believes that he's now a Judo expert, and tries to fight Fibber Fox; Chopper secretly lends a hand.

episodes.name: Yogi's Birthday Party
episodes.overview:
In this episode-length cartoon, Yogi is told that he'll be appearing on a television program. He tries to prepare for the show by taking lessons from Fred Upstairs, Boppy Barrin, and Lee B. Rocky (spoofs of Fred Astaire, Bobby Darin, and Liberace, respectively), but the lessons don't go well. Yogi is afraid that he'll ruin the show, but at the last minute he discovers that it's actually a surprise birthday tribute for him and that he doesn't have to do anything.

The "guests" who show up to honor Yogi include Ranger Smith, Huckleberry Hound, Quick Draw McGraw and Baba Looey, Pixie and Dixie and Mr. Jinks, Snooper and Blabber, Snagglepuss, Hokey Wolf and Ding-A-Ling, Augie Doggie and Doggie Daddy, Cindy Bear, Boo Boo, and Yakky Doodle.
